heading: Today
text: Some patchy morning fog, and some low clouds northeast, giving way to sun, then increasing clouds west to east, with showers developing in the St. Lawrence and NY early afternoon, spreading through VT into NH by late afternoon.  Breezy and warmer. Highs in the 50s.  South to southwest winds increasing to 10 to 15 mph, gusting to 25 mph this afternoon east of the Green Mountains, and 30 to 40 mph from the Green Mountains west.

heading: Tonight
text: Evening showers east, scattered west, then showers retreating to the higher terrain, mixing with snow, and diminishing. Partial clearing in southern valleys.  Lows ranging through the 30s.  Southwest winds becoming west 10 to 20 mph, gusting to 35 mph.

heading: Tuesday
text: Localized morning rain or snow showers in the north and mountains tapering off.  Morning sun in southern valleys, then increasing afternoon sun south, into the northern valleys.  Highs from the mid 40s to mid 50s north to south.  West winds, shifting to the northwest 10 to 20 mph, gusting to 35 mph.
